svcsection.title: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS PT PACER - 1991

svcproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para: PT Pacer is an electronically controlled, road speed governing system. System features include:

The PT Pacer system is a full-time electronic governor that receives power from the fuel shut-off solenoid whenever the ignition switch is in the "ON" position. It is available on 1991 Cummins L10 and N14 STC engines. STC engines are mechanically controlled engines, as opposed to the CELECT electronically controlled L10 and N14 engines.
The PT Pacer system includes a PT Pacer Control Unit (PCU) that is the processing device. The PCU stores the owner-specified operation/parameter information in the PCU memory.
The PCU receives input from the tachometer sensor and the speedometer sensor, processes the information and generates output signals.
The output signals from the PCU control the Electric Fuel Control valve (EFC), that can limit the amount of fuel to the injectors, in turn limiting road speed.
The PT Pacer utilizes the standard engine harness on the L10 and N14 STC engines. The tachometer and speedometer sensors are also standard on all models.
